name: wail
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] to make a long, high cry, usually because of pain or sadness: The women gathered around the coffin and began to wail, as was the custom in the region. [ + speech ] "My finger hurts," wailed the child.
[ I ] informal to complain loudly or strongly: [ + that ] Business people wailed that their trade would be ruined.
